sentence: Once upon a time, there was a little girl.
On her birthday, her grandmother gave her a little red riding hood.
She really liked it and always wore it.
So everyone called her Little Red Riding Hood.
One morning, her mother told her to visit her sick grandmother.
The little girl put on her little red riding hood as her mother prepared a special goody basket.
On her way, Little Red Riding Hood noticed some lovely flowers in the woods.
But unfortunately, she didn’t notice a wolf.
Suddenly, a big wolf appeared beside her.
I’m going to see my grandmother.
“She lives in the forest, near the big apple tree.”
“take some fresh flowers to your grandmother.
She will be happy to get them.”
The wolf, in the meantime, took a shortcut.
He arrived at Grandma’s and knocked on the door.
The wolf went into the room and swallowed poor grandmother.
He changed into her clothes and laid himself down in bed.
A few minutes later, Little Red Riding Hood knocked on the door.
Little Red Riding Hood went into the room.
“To hear your sweet voice, my dear.”
“To see your sweet face, my dear.”
And just like that, the wolf swallowed Little Red Riding Hood, too.
Feeling very full, the wolf fell asleep in bed, snoring loudly.
Just then, a hunter was passing by and heard the snoring.
The hunter went into the house.
He saw a wolf sleeping in grandmother’s bed.
He took a pair of scissors and cut open the wolf’s stomach.
There was Little Red Riding Hood and grandmother still alive.
I will never talk to strangers again.
I will always listen to you and mother.”
From then on, Little Red Riding Hood was careful and never spoke to strangers again!
